page.title: 04The River Lea, Harpenden
page.content: The River Lea at Batford is a most interesting area. Many birds nest there including this year, a family of grebes. The park nearby is very popular. Down by the river there is a forge. A blacksmith used to make horseshoes there. Now two brothers make beautiful wrought iron gates and will try to fix almost anything, even lawn mowers. The Upper Lea Valley Group try to do a lot of conservation work, including clearing and opening up the pathway where the railway used to run from Hemel Hempstead to Dunstable. They have created a very attractive weir, a waterfall and a stepping stone area near the park. The ford is a popular place for wading and fishing, the most usual catches being minnows, tadpoles and sticklebacks.
